isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - DESIGN TECHNOLOGY "TECH TIME" Model 3354 Dynamic Timing Meter - OPERATING PROCEDURES

step1.para: Clamp on the transducer to the #1 fuel injection line at the injection pump end.

item.para: THE TRANSDUCER MUST BE SECURELY ATTACHED ON A STRAIGHT SECTION OF THE FUEL LINE AT THE INJECTION PUMP END.
CLEAN THE FUEL LINE WITH ABRASIVE CLOTH OR STEEL WOOL TO REMOVE ALL PAINT PRIOR TO AFFIXING THE TRANSDUCER.
DO NOT ALLOW THE TRANSDUCER TO CONTACT THE INJECTION LINE NUT.
DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN THE TRANSDUCER ON THE FUEL LINE. A "SNUG" FIT IS ALL THAT IS NECESSARY FOR PULSE DETECTION.

step1.para: Connect ground clip from transducer to an appropriate ground.

Connect transducer to timing unit PICK-UP (4, Figure 4.11)
using transducer connecting cable (9, Figure 4.11).

important.para: TRANSDUCER MUST BE DRY. WET CONDITIONS CAN CAUSE ERRATIC READINGS. IF ERRATIC READINGS ARE OBSERVED, REMOVE TRANSDUCER, WIPE LINE AND TRANSDUCER WITH A CLEAN, DRY CLOTH AND SPRAY TRANSDUCER, ON ALL SURFACES, WITH A WATER DISPLACING SUBSTANCE, SUCH AS WD-40(r) AND RECLAMP ON THE FUEL LINE.

step1.para:
Connect the POWER SOURCE CLIPS (7, Figure 4.11
) to the vehicle battery terminals or 8 to 28 volt supply (red to "+" , black to "-"). OBSERVE POLARITY OR DAMAGE TO CABLES MAY RESULT!

important.para: ONLY THE TACHOMETER FUNCTION OF THE DYNAMIC TIMING METER MODEL 3354 IS USED TO DIAGNOSE DT/DTI/DTA-466 C DIESEL ENGINES. DYNAMIC TIMING IS NOT MEASURED.

para.emph: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series Engines use the timing light method for determining crankshaft position.
